SECTION_CONTENT:
Toxicological information: LD50: (oral rat): 5628 mg/kg, LC50 (inhalation rat): 64000 ppm vol./4 h LDL0: (oral human): 143 mg/kg.
Noncarcinogenic in animal experiments.
Other information: If fumes inhaled: Irritations to the respiratory tracts. Upon contact with the skin: Risk of cutaneous absorption. Through
contact with the eyes: Irritations. If swallowed: nausea, vomiting, headaches, vertigo, intoxication, sight disorders,
blindness (irreversible injury of the optic nerve). Systemic effects: acidosis, of the optic nerve). Systemic effects: acidosis, hypotension, anxiety, spasms, narcosis,
coma.
